message.content:
cs.CR, cs.GT, cs.CY, cs.SE, cs.SI

The paper discusses the economics and game-theoretic aspects of ransomware attacks, which falls under the category of computer security (cs.CR). The use of game theory to model the interaction between organizations and attackers suggests that the paper may also belong to the sub-category of game theory (cs.GT). The focus on the decision-making process of organizations and the economic incentives to pay a ransom or invest in backup technologies suggests that the paper may also belong to the sub-categories of cybercrime (cs.CY), software engineering (cs.SE), and social and information networks (cs.SI).
